  [Hobby Lobby](https://www.hobbylobby.com/) is recalling about 14,000 stools sold between June 2021 and July 2021. If you purchased one of these stools, beware: According to a [recall alert](https://www.cpsc.gov/Recalls/2022/Hobby-Lobby-Recalls-White-Wood-Stools-Due-to-Fall-and-Injury-Hazards) published by the Consumer Product Safety Commission, the stools can break during use, posing a fall and injury hazard to the user.

**This May Also Interest You:** [**What Do You Do When a Product Is Recalled? Here’s Everything You Need to Know**](https://www.homeserve.com/en-us/blog/home-improvement/what-is-product-recall/)

According to the Oct. 6 recall, there have been seven reports of the stools breaking during use, including six reports of minor injuries.

This recall involves the White Wood Stool, which has white legs and a brown wooden seat. The stools were made in China and sold in Hobby Lobby stores nationwide for about $80.

The CPSC is advising consumers to stop using these stools immediately. Return them to your local Hobby Lobby store for a full refund. You can contact the Oklahoma City, Okla.-based company at 800-326-7931 or online via the [recalls page](https://www.hobbylobby.com/customer-service/recalls). For more consumer product safety information, go to [cpsc.gov](https://www.cpsc.gov/).
